channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: OnePlus matches Samsung’s best-in-class (for Android) update plan
item.description: Flagship OnePlus phones get three major OS updates, four years of security updates.

item.title: Facebook, Twitter pledge to fight abuse of women but leave lots of room for failure
item.description: Will they just throw more algorithms at the problem?

item.title: Tesla has great quarter, delivers more than 200,000 EVs
item.description: Tesla says it has done an outstanding job navigating supply challenges.

item.title: Thinking about selling your Echo Dot—or any IoT device? Read this first
item.description: Deleting data from Echo Dots—and other IoT devices from Amazon and elsewhere—is hard.

item.title: General Motors looks to California for its next lithium supply
item.description: The US automaker is investing in closed-loop extraction from the Salton Sea.

item.title: 30 under $25: A collection of good hidden gem games from Steam’s Summer Sale
item.description: If you want something different to play, allow us to highlight some deeper cuts.

item.title: Rocket Report: Super Heavy rolls to launch site, Funk will get to fly
item.description: “I am not allowed to talk about that.”

item.title: Game on—Sir Richard Branson will attempt to go to space on July 11
item.description: “I truly believe that space belongs to all of us.”

item.title: Google Play dumps APKs for the more Google-controlled “Android App Bundle”
item.description: Starting in August, new apps will need to turn over their signing keys to Google.

item.title: How a 17th-century illustration is helping archaeologists find Viking ships
item.description: Danish antiquarian Ole Worm conducted the first survey of the Kalvestene in 1650.

item.title: Success of COVID-19 vaccines may be convincing people not to get vaccinated
item.description: As delta spreads, experts worry about vaccination holdouts who are standing firm.

item.title: NASA still trying to identify what took Hubble offline
item.description: Space agency needs to know exactly what’s wrong in order to switch to backup hardware.

item.title: Humble Bundle stops purchasers from giving full payment to charity
item.description: A minimum of 15 to 30 percent will now be reserved for Humble Bundle itself.

item.title: New MacBook Pro with new Apple chip, Mini LED display expected this fall
item.description: Mini LED suppliers are ramping up for a possible September release.

item.title: Judge tears Florida’s social media law to shreds for violating First Amendment
item.description: Judge blocks Florida law, calls it example of “burning the house to roast a pig.”

item.title: The Tim Berners-Lee NFT that sold for $5.4M might have an HTML error
item.description: Animation is fixed, but is evidence of the typo still in the blockchain?

item.title: New Jersey approves two 1 Gigawatt+ offshore wind projects
item.description: The agreements will see both projects rely on the state’s planned wind port.

item.title: Sony buys Nixxes, propelling potential for prodigious PlayStation-to-PC ports
item.description: Second studio purchase this week for Sony suggests a move past PlayStation.

item.title: Here’s what a Falcon 9 looks like after 8 flights to space in a year
item.description: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket has gone through a stunning transformation over the last year.

item.title: Virgin Orbit suddenly has a viable rocket, so what comes next?
item.description: “We’re in a different world where we were six months ago.”

item.title: If this is the electric Volvo of 2026, the future might not be all bad
item.description: These are the big tech upgrades Volvo is planning for its next-generation EVs.

item.title: Delta variant’s wild spread raises fears, fresh scrutiny of CDC mask guidance
item.description: States with low vaccination rates are already seeing a delta surge.

item.title: Amazon doesn’t like FTC chair Lina Khan’s views, wants her off investigations
item.description: Sensing a changing antitrust landscape, Amazon fires a warning shot.

item.title: Not just OLED: LG is about to release its first Mini LED TVs
item.description: New TV models hit the US in July, the rest of the world a few weeks later.

item.title: Robinhood ordered to pay $70m penalty to US regulator
item.description: It’s the largest penalty the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority has ever ordered.

item.title: More vaccine progress: This time, it’s malaria
item.description: Two recent papers describe strong protection against a difficult parasite.

item.title: Starlink’s “next-generation” user terminal will cost a lot less, Musk says
item.description: Musk expects near-global coverage in August and up to 500,000 users in one year.

item.title: A weird take on frame rate: How PS5’s first “40 fps” game works, runs
item.description: Not the same as Ratchet � Clank: Rift Apart’s 60 fps mode. We dive into the difference.

item.title: Dell’s $199 UltraSharp 4K webcam has AI on board—but no microphone
item.description: This high-tech webcam also offers an IR sensor for Windows Hello compatibility.

item.title: HP bets on AMD Ryzen 5000 in its new Pavilion Aero laptop lineup
item.description: Aero 13 will weigh under 1 kg, support Windows 11, and offer a 400-nit display.

item.title: Google commits to supporting Nest smart home devices for 5 years
item.description: Nest speakers, cameras, thermostats, displays, and more get solid support windows.

item.title: Google and Microsoft agree to start suing each other again
item.description: The tech giants end five years of quietly settling their differences.

item.title: SpaceX sends its Transporter-2 mission into orbit [Updated]
item.description: A charter helicopter scrubbed Tuesday’s attempt, apparently.

item.title: Relativity to open a huge factory that measures up to its grand ambitions
item.description: “It can fit the USC Coliseum inside of it.”

item.title: Hackers exploited 0-day, not 2018 bug, to mass-wipe My Book Live devices [Updated]
item.description: Western Digital removed code that would have prevented the wiping of petabytes of data.

item.title: Quantum-computing startup Rigetti to offer modular processors
item.description: Rigetti will build its machines from smaller parts instead of a monolithic chip.

item.title: The Lexus LS500 is beautifully crafted, but some tech shows its age
item.description: Lexus shook up the luxury car world in 1989, but how does it stack up in 2021?

item.title: Netflix once again introduces new features for Android, but not iOS (yet)
item.description: It’s not the first time Netflix changes hit Android first, iOS later.

item.title: Microsoft digitally signs malicious rootkit driver
item.description: Company still hasn’t revealed the cause of this serious security lapse.

item.title: Juul to pay N.C. $40M and stop targeting kids after igniting vaping “epidemic“
item.description: The settlement follows years of allegations that Juul egregiously targeted youth.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Apple AirPods Max, Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on indoor security cams and Steam Summer Sale picks.

item.title: Ohio GOP ends attempt to ban municipal broadband after protest from residents
item.description: Axed plan’s 10Mbps standard could have banned public networks in 98% of Ohio.

item.title: YouTube TV launches 4K support and offline playback for an extra $20
item.description: YouTube TV’s newest price tier adds 4K, offline playback, and unlimited streams.

item.title: What the heck’s an Intellivision Amico? Console’s leaky dev portal offers hints
item.description: Creators compare the $250 crowdfunded console’s power to a chip from a $100 2016 smartphone.

item.title: Amazon’s new price of doing business—the right to buy ownership stakes in vendors
item.description: The retailer has rights to buy $2.8 billion of potentially discounted stock.

item.title: Sony purchases Returnal developer Housemarque after successful PS5 debut
item.description: Finnish indie’s PlayStation exclusives date back to 2007’s Super Stardust HD.

item.title: Physicists confirm two cases of “elusive” black hole/neutron star mergers
item.description: When a neutron star and a black hole love each other very, very much….

item.title: Controversial Alzheimer’s drug could cost US $334B—nearly half of DoD budget
item.description: Despite unproven efficacy, Biogen set the drug’s list price at $56,000 per year.

item.title: AT&T gives investors and gov’t wildly different takes on need for fiber Internet
item.description: AT�T to investors: Fiber is the best! AT�T to gov’t: Don’t give rural people fiber!

item.title: Xbox Game Streaming exits beta, now works on all iOS devices, web browsers
item.description: Requires $15/mo Game Pass Ultimate sub; follows last week’s Series X server upgrade.

item.title: Venus’ clouds too dry, acidic for life
item.description: A new analysis checks the water available in different planets' atmospheres.

item.title: The Linux Foundation is working to improve voice recognition ethics
item.description: Want voice recognition but don’t trust Alexa? The Linux Foundation has your back.

item.title: We finally have a release date and new teaser for Apple TV+ series Foundation
item.description: First three episodes will debut on September 24, with weekly episodes after that.

item.title: Amazon is using algorithms with little human intervention to fire Flex workers
item.description: Retailer lets bots manage many HR decisions for its Flex delivery program.

item.title: Why is Russia launching a new module to the space station if it’s pulling out?
item.description: Nauka will be the largest module the Russians have sent to the ISS.

item.title: Qualcomm does the bare minimum for the new Snapdragon 888 Plus SoC
item.description: Five percent faster peak CPU clock and ambiguous AI improvements launch a new SKU.

item.title: How SNES emulators got a few pixels from complete perfection
item.description: From the archives: Revisit the work of a classic gaming emulation titan who died this week.

item.title: Newly discovered supernova may be same type as the one observed in 1054
item.description: SN 2018zd meets all the criteria for an “electron-capture” supernova.

item.title: On-road and off-road in the all-new Ford Bronco
item.description: There’s a dizzying combination of configurations, but they all feel unstoppable.
